item.title: About me
item.description: Hi, my name is Marko Živanović. I’m a software developer currently living in Germany.

item.title: Optimist, pessimist, and realist comment on tech
item.description: Is the glass half-empty or half-full? Know that one? The former depicts the views of our pessimist and the latter of our optimist on the state of the glass which volume is 50% occupied by some hypothetical liquid.

item.title: Tell me when I suck
item.description: I recently read a short blog post titled Saying the Difficult Things.

item.title: Winning over the TL;DR crowd
item.description: Bombarded with an endless stream of content to consume, the majority often skips longer publications.

item.title: Reading debt – bookmarking shit you’ll never read
item.description: Reading debt (also known as bookmark debt or Ctrl-D compulsion) is a concept in casual web browsing that reflects the implied cost of additional bookmark organization and undesirable future reading.

item.title: Screw it, I’ll host it myself
item.description: It’s all fun and games until someone loses an eye. Likewise, it’s all fun and games until someone loses access to their private and/or business data because they trusted it to someone else.

item.title: How to Install Plausible analytics on Ubuntu 20.10
item.description: As consumers are increasingly aware of the privacy issues on the modern web, that trend has opened up space for some interesting privacy-friendly tools to help you charge your business.

item.title: Can’t connect/SSH to Linux EC2 instance anymore
item.description: Chances are that you’re here because you did something stupid. You locked yourself out of your EC2 instance somehow.

item.title: Interview with the Cookie Monster
item.description: I had the privilege and sometimes the burden of interviewing dozens of developers in some of the companies I worked for previously.

item.title: Don’t ignore rejection emails
item.description: Many people are currently facing unemployment or have already been laid off.
